results.title: Good record keeping
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the requirements and importance of good record keeping for the New Tax System, implemented July 1, 2000. Presented by Michael Caton. Covers and defines such topics as: Acquisitions ; Australian Business Number ; Business Activity Statement ; GST-free ; Input taxed ; Input tax credit ; PAYG instalments ; PAYG withholding ; Supplies ; Taxable supplies ; Tax period.

results.title: Good news day
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: This film makes a statement about the attractiveness and cultural diversity of the Australian way of life by comparing scenes from Adelaide with the screaming headlines of newspapers and radio.

results.title: Good mothers
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Films Kompagni, Mogens Skot Hansen and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: Using unconventional directional and editing devices, this production provides an insight into Denmark’s progressive laws and social structures that protect mothers and their children. Shows how married and unmarried mothers in Denmark are provided with assistance through the nation-wide system of ‘Mother’s Aid Institution’. Describes in dramatised form the story of an unmarried mother. Free assistance includes pre-natal attention and classes in the care of children. Following the birth of her child in hospital in Copenhagen the mother spends some time at a Mother’s Aid home, where she receives instruction in homecrafts and is trained to earn a living. Also reveals that since 1888, fathers have been required by Danish law to financially support their children until the age of 18. Commentary by Dinah Miller.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nordisk Films Kompagni, Mogens Skot Hansen and Carl Theodor Dreyer

results.title: Good morning, Beijing = Beijing ni zao [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Youth Film Studio, Beijing Film Academy and Zhang Nuanxin
results.brief_description: Directed by one of the few women to have become prominent in China’s film industry, this film depicts the head-on collision between socialist and market ethics in 1980s Beijing through the work and romantic lives of a group of young adults. The equilibrium between three friends who work as bus conductors is disturbed as they seize upon new challenges and opportunities that open up to them as a result of economic reforms. Cast includes Ma Xiaoqing and Wang Quan’an. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Good morning Babylon
results.creator_credit: Filmtre, MK2 Productions, Pressman Film Corporation, RA11, Films A2, Giuliani De Negri, Paolo Taviani and Vittorio Taviani
results.brief_description: The Taviani Brothers’ first English language film is a bitter-sweet and joyous celebration of the early days of Hollywood movie making. Based on a true story, the film is a piece of pure and thrilling cinema and features an acclaimed performance by Charles Dance as the legendary director D.W. Griffith. Two Tuscan stonemason brothers decide to leave Italy for the New World when their father’s firm becomes bankrupt. They travel to Hollywood and wangle their way onto the film set of Griffith. They fall in love and celebrate a double wedding, however war soon intervenes to threaten their happiness.

results.title: Good Monday morning (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the impact of new technology on women office workers. It presents various personal perspective’s on the working life and illustrates a cross-section of contemporary conditions.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cinar Films, Miramax Films, Micheline Charest, Ronald A Weinberg and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David the gnome enters the wonderful world of adventure as he tries to help his fellow creatures out of trouble. This program consists of 2 episodes, ‘Good Medicine’ captures David’s skills as a doctor and ‘Witch Way Out?’ finds David and his faithful fox, Swift, captured by ugly and vicious trolls. Based on the book “The Gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Will Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out
results.creator_credit: Cinar Films, Miramax Films, BRB International, Micheline Charest, Ronald A Weinberg and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
Join David, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, for two wonderful adventures in the secret and magical world of the gnomes. “Good medicine” tells how David’s skill as a doctor is needed to help a sick animal. In ‘Witch way out” David and Swift are captured by the ugly and vicious trolls. Based on “The gnomes’ by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Good lighting. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Peter Combes
results.brief_description: Shows how the balance of studio lighting is controlled by the faders on a lighting console. The problems arising from a high or a low overall light level are explained and the use of the lens iris is discussed. The limited contrast range needed for a television camera is demonstrated. Presented by Bob Holness.
